intro: Tragopogon brevirostris var. volgensis, commonly known as the narrow-beaked goat's beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lanceolate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces bright yellow composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to the western United States and thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
